meanings.definition: relating to the scientific study of animal behavior
meanings.sent1: The ethological research team observed the monkeys in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent2: Her ethological approach to studying bird migration patterns was highly respected.
meanings.sent3: The ethological expert chuckled as she watched the playful otters interact.
meanings.sent4: His ethological insights into bee communication were as clear as a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The students were fascinated by the ethological experiments on fish behavior.

meanings.definition: the study of animal behavior in natural environments
meanings.sent1: Ethological studies often involve observing animals in the wild.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue a career in ethological research after a trip to the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The ethological class took a field trip to observe squirrels in the park.
meanings.sent4: His passion for ethological research was as deep as the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The book on ethological principles opened her eyes to the wonders of nature.
